text: GH-Actions isn't always triggering today. Is that... a thing?

text: i moved my 4 repos to  GA yesterday. it was not my fault to run a lot of docker images :man-raising-hand:. btw, transitioning from travis to GA was very smooth. thanks to those who created good templates to make the transition easy.

elements.text: i moved my 4 repos to  GA yesterday. it was not my fault to run a lot of docker images
. btw, transitioning from travis to GA was very smooth. thanks to those who created good templates to make the transition easy.

text: I am dying to know why GitHub is having so many issues this year. Did they migrate to Azure and Azure is hitting internal scaling limits? Is the GitHub Actions service itself falling over due to its basically-unlimited offering?

elements.text: I am dying to know why GitHub is having so many issues this year. Did they migrate to Azure and Azure is hitting internal scaling limits? Is the GitHub Actions service itself falling over due to its basically-unlimited offering?

text: possible they gonna make it a reason to charge. crossing finger.

elements.text: possible they gonna make it a reason to charge. crossing finger.

text: this reminds me when google and amazon provided unlimited cloud drive for just 65€ and then after a year or two changed their minds. same with google mail. unlimited and then pooof. the unlimited thing is just to attract users. same with travis. for sure, a lot will be migrating from travis and then it will no longer be free as they have big userbase to get money.
